titlestmt.titleproper: Wagner Free Institute of Science South Dakota Expedition records 1990-1990
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science South Dakota Expedition records

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. In 1990, the Wagner Free Institute of Science participated in an expedition to South Dakota, conducted jointly with the South Dakota School of Mines and Technology and the New Jersey State Museum. The Wagner's team was made up of Professor William Gallagher and Curator Eugene A. Bolt, Jr.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials relating to that expedition, including itineraries, financial records, articles on the geology and fossils of South Dakota, tourist brochures, snapshots, and postcards. Also included are maps and publications of the South Dakota Geological Survey. Eugene Bolt submitted a report on the expedition upon his return, and a copy of that is included in these materials. Of note is the herbarium compiled by Bolt during the trip.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
